text: was a town located in Oku District, Okayama Prefecture, Japan. As of 2003, the town had an estimated population of 19,389 and a density of 282.19 persons per km². The total area was 68.71 km². On November 1, 2004, Oku, along with the towns of Osafune and Ushimado (all from Oku District), was merged to create the city of Setouchi. Category:Dissolved municipalities of Okayama Prefecture Category:Populated places disestablished in 2004 Category:2004 disestablishments in Japan
title: Oku, Okayama
